Imports

geometry, levels, graphs

Types

GameState = object
  level*: Level
  line*: Line
  linePoints: HashSet[Point2D]
  status*: LineStatus
  nxtMovesChoice*: seq[Point2D]
  nxtMovesGrid*: Table[Point2D, Point2D]
  cellEdges: HashSet[LineSegment]
  edgesOfCell: Table[seq[Point2D], HashSet[LineSegment]]

LineStatus = enum
  None, OnlyGridNeighbors, HasDiagNeighbors, CorrectSolution, IncorrectSolution
This is used when adding a new point to the player's line

Procs

proc addPointAndCheckResult(game: var GameState; point: Point2D) {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Adds a point to the player line and updates valid next moves in game state. This function assumes that only correct points from game state's next moves are given. 
func checkSolution(game: GameState): bool {....raises: [ValueError, KeyError],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks if the player line is a correct solution. First step is room division, second step is checking hexes and the rest of the symbols are checked based on room division results. 
func divideSymbolsToRooms(game: GameState): seq[MazeRoom] {.
    ...raises: [ValueError, KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Divides the level into rooms based on the player's line. Checks triangle symbols at the same time. Combined segments mentioned above are used to make sure that the room division dfs doesn't slip through the player line when there are e.g. non-integer coordinates. 
func getLineSegments(game: GameState): HashSet[LineSegment] {.
    ...raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Returns player line segments. Also returns 2 line segments combined into 1 if there are points that are in the middle of a cell's edge. 
func goesFromStartToEnd(line: Line; l: Level): bool {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks if the line is a valid path from start to end. Only used in tests as the game uses functions that make sure the line is valid. 
proc init(game: var GameState; levelName: string) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, ThawError, Exception],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect], forbids: [].}
Initializes game state object so it is ready for the player's first move 
proc neighborInDirection(game: var GameState; direction: Point2D): Option[
    Point2D] {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
This function returns the neighboring point in the maze in a given direction if it is a valid move 
proc setLine(game: var GameState; line: Line) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
For testing use only. This function assumes that the line follows the rules of the game.
